timeline.message:
(PLUGIN-165) Added fetchSize property to DBSource

JDBC supports Statement.setFetchSize to provide JDBC driver hint on pre-fetching/buffering rows. Exposing this through the DB Source configuration would allow users fine tune the reading performance.

timeline.bodyText: Do we know what's the behavior when each row is gigantic? OOM ? or JDBC is intelligent to stream data in piecemeal (i.e. smaller than fetch size)
timeline.author: wyzhang

replies.bodyText: No, JDBC won't do that. The process can go OOM if that happen. That's why the fetch size and the executor resources need to be set accordingly, which is mentioned in the description of this attribute
replies.author: chtyim
